page.title: 04WHARLES
page.content: Wharles is a hamlet of farmsteads with some privately owned and some council owned residential dwellings. The Eagle and Child, an attractive white washed building is the only public house. The main land owners are Cluttens (pension trust) and the Department of the Enviroment who own several acres of land in Wharles, occupied by H.M.S. Inskip. Rabbits, partridge and pheasants are still a common sight in the area. There is no school and the local primary age children attend the school at Treales.The secondary school age children travel by bus to Kirkham and adults can also travel on this bus.There is also one bus a week to Kirkham on market day (Thursday). There are travelling fish, vegetable and library vans. Meat is only delivered to order, the working smithy functions no longer as a blacksmith.
